   20: 
   21: -module(beam_types_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -define(BEAM_TYPES_INTERNAL, true).
   24: -include_lib("compiler/src/beam_types.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   28: 
   29: -export([absorption/1,
   30:          associativity/1,
   31:          commutativity/1,
   32:          idempotence/1,
   33:          identity/1,
   34:          subtraction/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([binary_absorption/1,
   37:          integer_absorption/1,
   38:          integer_associativity/1,
   39:          tuple_absorption/1,
   40:          tuple_set_limit/1]).
   41: 
   42: suite() ->
   43:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   44: 
   45: all() ->
   46:     [{group,property_tests},
   47:      binary_absorption,
   48:      integer_absorption,
   49:      integer_associativity,
   50:      tuple_absorption,
   51:      tuple_set_limit].
   52: 
   53: groups() ->
   54:     [{property_tests,[parallel],
   55:       [absorption,
   56:        associativity,
   57:        commutativity,
   58:        idempotence,
   59:        identity,
   60:        subtraction]}].
   61: 
   62: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   63:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config).
   64: 
   65: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: absorption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   69:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:absorption()).
   70:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:absorption(), Config).
   71: 
   72: associativity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:associativity()).
   74:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:associativity(), Config).
   75: 
   76: commutativity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   77:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:commutativity()).
   78:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:commutativity(), Config).
   79: 
   80: idempotence(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:idempotence()).
   82:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:idempotence(), Config).
   83: 
   84: identity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:identity()).
   86:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:identity(), Config).
   87: 
   88: subtraction(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   89:     %% manual test: proper:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:subtraction()).
   90:     true = ct_property_test:quickcheck(beam_types_prop:subtraction(), Config).
   91: 
   92: binary_absorption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   93:     %% These binaries should meet into {binary,12} as that's the best common
   94:     %% unit for both types.
   95:     A = #t_bitstring{size_unit=4},
   96:     B = #t_bitstring{size_unit=6},
   97: 
   98:     #t_bitstring{size_unit=12} = beam_types:meet(A, B),
   99:     #t_bitstring{size_unit=2} = beam_types:join(A, B),
  100: 
  101:     A = beam_types:meet(A, beam_types:join(A, B)),
  102:     A = beam_types:join(A, beam_types:meet(A, B)),
  103: 
  104:     %% Tests that the appendable flag behaves as intended.
  105:     C = #t_bitstring{size_unit=4,appendable=true},
  106:     D = #t_bitstring{size_unit=6},
  107: 
  108:     #t_bitstring{size_unit=12,appendable=true} = beam_types:meet(C, D),
  109:     #t_bitstring{size_unit=2,appendable=false} = beam_types:join(C, D),
  110: 
  111:     C = beam_types:meet(C, beam_types:join(C, D)),
  112:     C = beam_types:join(C, beam_types:meet(C, D)),
  113: 
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: integer_absorption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  117:     %% Integers that don't overlap at all should never meet.
  118:     A = #t_integer{elements={2,3}},
  119:     B = #t_integer{elements={4,5}},
  120: 
  121:     none = beam_types:meet(A, B),
  122:     #t_integer{elements={2,5}} = beam_types:join(A, B),
  123: 
  124:     A = beam_types:meet(A, beam_types:join(A, B)),
  125:     A = beam_types:join(A, beam_types:meet(A, B)),
  126: 
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: integer_associativity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     A = #t_integer{elements={3,5}},
  131:     B = #t_integer{elements={4,6}},
  132:     C = #t_integer{elements={5,5}},
  133: 
  134:     %% a ∨ (b ∨ c) = (a ∨ b) ∨ c,
  135:     LHS_Join = beam_types:join(A, beam_types:join(B, C)),
  136:     RHS_Join = beam_types:join(beam_types:join(A, B), C),
  137:     #t_integer{elements={3,6}} = LHS_Join = RHS_Join,
  138: 
  139:     %% a ∧ (b ∧ c) = (a ∧ b) ∧ c.
  140:     LHS_Meet = beam_types:meet(A, beam_types:meet(B, C)),
  141:     RHS_Meet = beam_types:meet(beam_types:meet(A, B), C),
  142:     #t_integer{elements={5,5}} = LHS_Meet = RHS_Meet,
  143: 
  144:     ok.
  145: 
  146: tuple_absorption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  147:     %% An inexact tuple can't meet an exact one that's smaller
  148: 
  149:     A = #t_tuple{size=3,exact=true,
  150:                  elements=#{1 => #t_atom{elements=[gurka]}}},
  151:     B = #t_tuple{size=5,exact=false,
  152:                  elements=#{3 => #t_atom{elements=[gaffel]}}},
  153: 
  154:     A = beam_types:meet(A, beam_types:join(A, B)),
  155:     A = beam_types:join(A, beam_types:meet(A, B)),
  156: 
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: tuple_set_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     %% When joining two tuple sets of differing sizes, the resulting set could
  161:     %% become larger than ?TUPLE_SET_LIMIT.
  162: 
  163:     As = [#t_tuple{size=N,exact=true,
  164:                    elements=#{ 1 => #t_integer{elements={N,N}} }} ||
  165:              N <- lists:seq(1, ?TUPLE_SET_LIMIT)],
  166: 
  167:     Bs = [#t_tuple{size=1,exact=true,
  168:                    elements=#{ 1 => #t_integer{elements={N,N}} }} ||
  169:              N <- lists:seq(1, ?TUPLE_SET_LIMIT)],
  170: 
  171:     A = beam_types:join(As),
  172:     B = beam_types:join(Bs),
  173: 
  174:     beam_types:verified_type(beam_types:join(A, B)),
  175: 
  176:     ok.
